answers.answer: Dear Bob:Just a couple of things.  First, if you feel you might have type II diabetes, get tested.  Just an FYI, many people drink alot and urinate alot and do not have diabetes.  So, get tested.  Second, there is a rare autoantibody syndrome that effects the peripheral ganglia.  I really don't know that much about it but I was at a seminar and heard just a brief tid bit.  It causes a dysautonomia.  They are doing some research at the Harvard, maybe check their website.Sincerely,CCF Neuro MD

question: Dear Doc,(from bob)I just got one last post and I
title: how about this?
